autorun.description: Execute terminals automatically at startup or when the project is added to the workspace

autokill.description: Kill all the terminals created from this configuration when the project is removed from the workspace

multiplexer.description: The terminal multiplexer that persistent terminals will use

autorun.description: Execute the terminal automatically at startup or when the project is added to the workspace

autokill.description: Kill the terminal when the project is removed from the workspace

name.description: The name of the terminal, it will be displayed in the dropdown

icon.description: An icon to show next to the name

cwd.description: A path for the current working directory to be used for the terminal

persistent.description: Keep the process running even when closing the terminal and reuse it, preservig the output. This unique session name will be passed to the terminal multiplexer

split.description: The name of the other (open) terminal to split from

target.description: Execute the commands in this terminal's instance

dynamicTitle.description: Don't use the "name" as the title, let it be dynamic depending on the command being executed

execute.description: Write the last command without executing it

focus.description: Open the terminal after executing its commands and focus to it

open.description: Open the terminal after executing its commands, but don't move the focus to it

onlyAPI.description: Don't run this with the "Terminals: Run" command and hide it from the "Terminals: Run Single" command, useful when programmatically calling the "terminals.runTerminalByName" command

onlySingle.description: Don't run this with the "Terminals: Run" command

onlyMultiple.description: Hide it from the "Terminals: Run Single" command

env.description: Object containing additional environment variables that will be applied to this terminal

multiplexer.description: The terminal multiplexer that this terminal will use, if persistent

shellPath.description: Path to a custom shell executable

shellArgs.description: Arguments to pass to the shell executable
